sen.j: 弾正台（だんじょうだい、彈正臺）は、下記のとおりである。
sen.e: Danjodai is
Danjodai is
Danjodai is as follows.
sen.cmt: 原文訳文ともに「下記のとおりである。」を補いました。

sen.j: 律令制下の日本の官制の一つ
sen.e: one of the government-regulated organizations or facilities under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
one of the government-regulated organizations or facilities under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
one of the government-regulated organizations or facilities under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: 明治時代の省庁の一つ
sen.e: It was one of the government offices in Meiji era.
It was one of the government offices in the Meiji era.
It was one of the government offices in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 弾正台 (律令制)
sen.e: Danjodai (under the Ritsuryo system)
Danjodai (under the Ritsuryo system)
Danjodai (under the Ritsuryo system)

sen.j: 律令体制時代の弾正台は監察・警察機構。
sen.e: Danjodai under the Ritsuryo system was supervision and police agency.
Danjodai under the Ritsuryo system was a supervision and police agency.
Danjodai under the Ritsuryo system was a supervision and police agency.

sen.j: 主な職務は中央行政の監察、京内の風俗の取り締まりであった。
sen.e: One of the agency's main duties was to regulate the central administration and public morals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: One of the agency's main duties was to regulate the central administration and public morals.
One of the agency's main duties was to regulate the central administration and public morals.

sen.j: 左大臣以下の非違を摘発し、奏聞できた。
sen.e: It had the right to detect the wrong doings of Sadaijin (Minister of the left) and under.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It had the right to detect the wrong doings of Sadaijin (Minister of the left) and under.
It had the right to detect the wrong doings of Sadaijin (Minister of the left) and under.

sen.j: 太政官の影響を受けないよう独立した機関として設置された。
sen.e: It was established as an independent agency so as not to be affected by Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was established as an independent agency so as not to be affected by Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
It was established as an independent agency so as not to be affected by Daijokan (Grand Council of State).

sen.j: だが、実際は太政官の因事管隷のもと､充分機能した例は少ない。
sen.e: But, in fact, there were few cases that the agency functioned well because of the Daijokan's supreme power to control all the departments in the ancient court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But, in fact, there were few cases that the agency functioned well because of the Daijokan's supreme power to control all the departments in the ancient court.
But, in fact, there were few cases that the agency functioned well because of the Daijokan's supreme power to control all the departments in the ancient court.

sen.j: 裁判権・警察権も刑部省・各官司が握っていた。
sen.e: Gyobusho (Ministry of Justice) and each official had jurisdiction and police power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Gyobusho (Ministry of Justice) and each official had jurisdiction and police power.
Gyobusho (Ministry of Justice) and each official had jurisdiction and police power.

sen.j: このため、非違を発見した場合でも直接逮捕・裁判する権限はない。
sen.e: Therefore, even when the officials of the agency found violations, they could not arrest or put the violators to court for trial.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, even when the officials of the agency found violations, they could not arrest or put the violators to court for trial.
Therefore, even when the officials of the agency found violations, they could not arrest or put the violators to court for trial.

sen.j: 長官たる尹は従三位相当官で、親王が任ぜられることが多く弾正宮などど呼ばれた。
sen.e: In, who was the chief of the agency, was an official equivalent to Junior third court rank, and in many cases Imperial princes were appointed to the position and called Danjo no Miya.
In, who was the chief of the agency, was an official equivalent to Junior third court rank, and in many cases Imperial princes were appointed to the position and called Danjo no Miya.
In, who was the chief of the agency, was an official equivalent to Junior third court rank, and in many cases Imperial princes were appointed to the position and called Danjo no Miya.

sen.j: また大納言で兼帯することもあり、尹大納言などど言われた例がある。
sen.e: Also, Dainagon (chief counselor of state) sometimes filled the position of Danjodai, and in such cases they were called In Dainagon.
Also, Dainagon (chief counselor of state) sometimes filled the position of Danjodai, and in such cases they were called In Dainagon.
Also, Dainagon (chief counselor of state) sometimes filled the position of Danjodai, and in such cases they were called In Dainagon.

sen.j: なお、単に「弾正」と称した場合には弾正台の職員を指す。
sen.e: In addition, when it is called simply 'danjo', it means the officials of danjodai.
In addition, when it is called simply 'danjo', it means the officials of danjodai.
In addition, when it is called simply 'danjo', it means the officials of danjodai.

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇時代に検非違使が創設されて以来、徐々に権限を奪われ有名無実化した。
sen.e: Since the position of kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) was established during the era of Saga Emperor, danjodai was gradually shorn of its authority and became titular.
Since the position of kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) was established during the era of Saga Emperor, danjodai was gradually shorn of its authority and became titular.
Since the position of kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) was established during the era of Emperor Saga, danjodai was gradually shorn of its authority and became titular.

sen.j: なお織田信長は、尾張国半国守護代たる織田氏（清洲三奉行尾張国守護代家 / 織田大和守家とも）の分家で代々の当主が「弾正忠」を自称していた一族（清洲三奉行弾正忠家と称される）の出身である。
sen.e: In addition, Nobunaga ODA came from a clan whose successive lords called themselves as 'danjo no chu' (Kiyosu sanbugyo danjo (three magistrates of Kiyosu) no chu family), and the clan was a branch family of Oda clan, the shugodai (deputy military governor) lords of half part of Owari Province (also called as Kiyosu sanbugyo in Owari province shugodai family or the Oda Yamatonokami family).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, Nobunaga ODA came from a clan whose successive lords called themselves 'danjo no chu' (Kiyosu sanbugyo danjo (three magistrates of Kiyosu) no chu family), and the clan was a branch family of Oda clan, the shugodai (deputy military governor) lords of half part of Owari Province (also called Kiyosu sanbugyo in Owari province shugodai family or the Oda Yamatonokami family).

In addition, Nobunaga ODA came from a clan whose successive lords called themselves 'danjo no chu' (Kiyosu sanbugyo [three magistrates of Kiyosu] danjo no chu family), and the clan was a branch family of Oda clan, the shugodai (deputy military governor) of half part of Owari Province (also called Kiyosu sanbugyo in Owari province shugodai family or the Oda Yamatonokami family).
sen.cmt: 括弧内の括弧を[]に変更し、位置を清洲三奉行の後にしました。Lords 削除しました。（governor と重複するため。）

sen.j: したがって信長自身も弾正忠を称している。
sen.e: Therefore, Nobunaga called himself as danjo no chu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, Nobunaga called himself danjo no chu.
Therefore, Nobunaga called himself danjo no chu.

sen.j: その他に弾正忠を称した武将としては戦国きっての梟雄・松永久秀や武田氏家臣の三弾正こと高坂昌信（逃げ弾正）、真田幸隆（攻め弾正）、保科正俊（槍弾正） などが特に知られている。
sen.e: In addition to Nobunaga, the well-known busho (Japanese military commander) who called themselves as danjo no chu are Hidehisa MASTUNAGA who was one of the most fierce warriors in Sengoku period (period of warring states) and the three danjo in the vassals of Takeda clan: Masanobu KOSAKA (the nige (fleeing) danjo), Yukitaka SANADA (the seme (offensive) danjo) and Masatoshi HOSHINA (the Yari (spear) danjo).

In addition to Nobunaga, the well-known busho (Japanese military commander) who called themselves danjo no chu are Hidehisa MASTUNAGA who was one of the most fierce warriors in Sengoku period (period of warring states) and the three danjo in the vassals of Takeda clan: Masanobu KOSAKA (the nige (fleeing) danjo), Yukitaka SANADA (the seme (offensive) danjo) and Masatoshi HOSHINA (the Yari (spear) danjo).

In addition to Nobunaga, the well-known busho (Japanese military commander) who called themselves danjo no chu are Hidehisa MATSUNAGA who was one of the most fierce warriors in Sengoku period (period of warring states) and the three danjo in the vassals of Takeda clan: Masanobu KOSAKA (the nige [fleeing] danjo), Yukitaka SANADA (the seme [offensive] danjo) and Masatoshi HOSHINA (the yari [spear] danjo).
sen.cmt: MASTUNAGA→MATSUNAGA括弧内の括弧を[]に変更Yari→yari

sen.j: 職員
sen.e: Staff
Staff
Staff

sen.j: 四等官は下記のとおりである。
sen.e: Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks) are
Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks) are
Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks) are as follows.
sen.cmt: 原文訳文ともに「下記のとおりである。」を補いました。

sen.j: 弾正尹（いん）
sen.e: Danjoin
Danjoin
Danjoin (President of the Board of Censors)
one
one

sen.e: Daihitsu (senior assistant)
Daihitsu (senior assistant)
Daihitsu (senior assistant)
one
one

sen.e: shohitsu (assistant director of danjodai)
shohitsu (assistant director of danjodai)

sen.j: 少忠（しょうちゅう）
sen.e: Shochu (Junior inspector, third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period)
Shochu (Junior inspector, third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period)
Shochu (Junior inspector, third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period)

sen.j: その下には台掌（だいしょう）、巡察弾正などの役も置かれた。
sen.e: Under the Shoso, the positions of daisho (administrative officials of danjodai (the Board of Censors)) and junsatsu- danjo (patrolling censors) were set up.
Under the Shoso, the positions of daisho (administrative officials of danjodai (the Board of Censors)) and junsatsu- danjo (patrolling censors) were set up.
Under the Shoso, the positions of daisho (administrative officials of danjodai) and junsatsu-danjo (patrolling censors) were set up.
sen.cmt: 弾正台の説明は省きました。余分なスペース削除

sen.j: 弾正台 (明治時代)
sen.e: Danjodai (Meiji Period)
Danjodai (Meiji Period)
Danjodai (Meiji Period)

sen.j: 明治時代に入り、1869年（明治2年）に新政府の監察機関として改めて京都市に設置された。
sen.e: In the Meiji Period, in 1869 it was newly established in Kyoto City as an inspection agency of the new government.
In the Meiji Period, in 1869 it was newly established in Kyoto City as an inspection agency of the new government.
In the Meiji Period, in 1869 it was newly established in Kyoto City as an inspection agency of the new government.

sen.j: 設置に際しては、維新後、開国政策を進める新政府にとってもてあまし気味の存在となっていた過激尊皇攘夷派の不平分子らの懐柔を目的に、彼らを多く採用したいきさつがあった。
sen.e: When it was established, the agency employed many radical discontented elements in the party of Sonno Joi (advocating respecting the Emperor and excluding of foreigners) in order to conciliate them, who had been beyond control of the new government that were advancing the policy of "opening the country."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When it was established, the agency employed many radical discontented elements in the party of Sonno Joi (advocating respecting the Emperor and excluding of foreigners) in order to conciliate them, who had been beyond control of the new government that were advancing the policy of "opening the country."

When it was established, the agency employed many radical discontented elements in the party of Sonno Joi (advocating respecting the Emperor and excluding of foreigners) in order to conciliate them, who had been beyond control of the new government that were advancing the policy of "opening the country."

sen.j: したがって新政府の改革政策に反対する方針を採ることもしばしばであったため、他の官庁との対立が深まった。
sen.e: Therefore, as the radicals often opposed to the reform policy of the new government, they were increasingly confronted with other agencies in the government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, as the radicals often opposed the reform policy of the new government, they were increasingly confronted with other agencies in the government.
Therefore, as the radicals often opposed the reform policy of the new government, they were increasingly confronted with other agencies in the government.

sen.j: しかし監察機関であるがゆえに政府内での彼らの権限は小さかった。
sen.e: However, their authority power was small because it was an inspection agency.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, their authority was small because it was an inspection agency.
However, their authority was small because it was an inspection agency.

sen.j: 主流派から外された弾正台の尊攘派は、府藩県・各省の非違を糾すという名目で、彼らの政敵たる開国派をやり玉に挙げる程度で満足しなければならなかった。
sen.e: Sonno Joi party in danjodai that was out of the mainstream had to be content with only severely criticizing kaikokuha (the opening country wing) which was their rival by nominally accusing fu-han-ken (prefectures) of their wrong doings.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sonno Joi party in danjodai that was out of the mainstream had to be content with only severely criticizing kaikokuha (the opening country wing) which was their rival by nominally accusing fu-han-ken (prefectures) of their wrong doings.

Sonno Joi party in danjodai that was out of the mainstream had to be content with only severely criticizing kaikokuha (the opening country wing) which was their rival by nominally accusing other agencies and fu-han-ken (prefectures) of their wrong doings.
sen.cmt: 「各省の」 訳漏れ対応しました。原文の文末を「。」としました。

sen.j: （なお当時大学大丞であった加藤弘之（後の東京大学綜理）も天長節儀式に欠席したことを弾正台に指弾され、謹慎処分を受けている）。
sen.e: (In one instance, daigaku daijo (chancellors of universities) Hiroyuki KATO (later president of Tokyo University) was accused by danjodai and suspended because he was absent from the event of tencho setsu (the birthday of the reigning emperor)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (In one instance, daigaku daijo (chancellors of universities) Hiroyuki KATO (later president of Tokyo University) was accused by danjodai and suspended because he was absent from the event of tencho setsu (the birthday of the reigning emperor).

(In one instance, daigaku daijo [chancellors of universities] Hiroyuki KATO [later president of Tokyo University]) was accused by danjodai and suspended because he was absent from the event of tencho setsu (the birthday of the reigning emperor).
sen.cmt: 括弧内の括弧を[]に変更文頭の括弧の閉じ括弧が抜けていたので付けました。

sen.j: とりわけ横井小楠および大村益次郎の暗殺事件においては、取り締まるべき弾正台の古賀十郎や海江田信義が横井・大村の政策を非難した。
sen.e: Especially, in the case of assassination of Shonan YOKOI and Masujiro OMURA, Juro KOGA and Nobuyoshi KAIEDA in danjodai who should have cracked down on it criticized the policy of Yokoi and Omura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Especially, in the case of assassination of Shonan YOKOI and Masujiro OMURA, Juro KOGA and Nobuyoshi KAIEDA in danjodai who should have cracked down on it criticized the policy of Yokoi and Omura.
Especially, in the case of assassination of Shonan YOKOI and Masujiro OMURA, Juro KOGA and Nobuyoshi KAIEDA in danjodai who should have cracked down on it criticized the policy of Yokoi and Omura.

sen.j: 暗殺は彼らの自業自得であると主張、あまつさえ暗殺犯の減刑までも主張するに至った。
sen.e: They insisted that Yokoi and Omura got what they deserved, and so far as to ask for the assassinator's reduced sentence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They insisted that Yokoi and Omura got what they deserved, and so far as to ask for the assassin's reduced sentence.
They insisted that Yokoi and Omura got what they deserved, and so far as to ask for the assassin's reduced sentence.

sen.j: 1870年（明治3年）5月、特に過激であった古賀のほか大巡察8名が人員削減を名目に免官となった。
sen.e: In 1870, Koga who was extremely radical and other eight Dai junsatsu were dismissed in the name of the reduction of personnel.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1870, Koga who was extremely radical and eight other Dai junsatsu were dismissed in the name of the reduction of personnel.
In May, 1870, Koga who was extremely radical and eight other Dai junsatsu were dismissed in the name of the reduction of personnel.

sen.j: これを機に政府による尊攘派切り捨てが本格化した。
sen.e: Taking this opportunity, the government began in earnest discarding sonjo party.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Taking this opportunity, the government began in earnest discarding the sonjo party.
Taking this opportunity, the government began in earnest discarding the sonjo party.

sen.j: そして弾正台自体も刑部省への統合が決定され、1871年（明治4年）司法省に統合された。
sen.e: And with the decision to integrate danjodai into Gyobusho (the department of criminal punishments), danjodai itself was integrated into the Ministry of Justice.
And with the decision to integrate danjodai into Gyobusho (the department of criminal punishments), danjodai itself was integrated into the Ministry of Justice.
And with the decision to integrate danjodai into Gyobusho (the department of criminal punishments), danjodai itself was integrated into the Ministry of Justice.

sen.j: なお免官となった古賀は翌1872年、愛宕通旭らとともに新政府転覆のための挙兵を企てた（二卿事件）ことをもって梟首に処せられている。
sen.e: In addition, dismissed Koga with Michiteru OTAGI were sentenced to exposure of their severed head in following 1872 on the charge of the attempt to topple the government (Nikyo Jiken (The Incidents triggered by two court nobles)).

In addition, dismissed Koga with Michiteru OTAGI were sentenced to exposure of their severed heads in 1872 on the charge of the attempt to topple the government (Nikyo Jiken (The Incidents triggered by two court nobles)).

In addition, dismissed Koga with Michiteru OTAGI were sentenced to exposure of their severed heads in 1872 on the charge of the attempt to topple the government (Nikyo Jiken [The Incidents triggered by two court nobles]).
sen.cmt: 括弧内の括弧を[]に変更

sen.j: 「弾正」姓
sen.e: The family name of 'DANJO'
The family name of 'DANJO'
The family name of 'DANJO'

sen.j: 佐渡に「弾正」姓を名乗る人々がいる。
sen.e: Some people in Sado Island name the family name of 'DANJO.'
Some people in Sado Island have the family name of 'DANJO.'
Some people in Sado Island have the family name of 'Danjo.'
